premises: If a circuit is open, then current does not flow
incorrect conclusions: The circuit is open and current flows
If current flows, then the circuit is open
If current does not flow, then the circuit is open
If the circuit is not open, then current flows

premises: If a material is an insulator, then it does not conduct electricity
conclusions: The material is not an insulator
incorrect conclusions: The material is an insulator and it conducts electricity
If the material conducts electricity, then it is an insulator
If the material does not conduct electricity, then it is an insulator
If the material is not an insulator, then it does not conduct electricity

premises: If a beam is properly reinforced, then it does not collapse under load
conclusions: The beam is not properly reinforced
incorrect conclusions: The beam is properly reinforced and it collapses under load
If the beam collapses under load, then it is properly reinforced
If the beam does not collapse under load, then it is properly reinforced
If the beam is not properly reinforced, then it does not collapse under load
